flower.title: Flower of Life
flower.subtitle: Sacred Geometry
flower.desc: Pattern of overlapping circles representing the fundamental forms of space.

bronchial.title: Bronchial Tree
bronchial.subtitle: Biomimicry
bronchial.desc: Recursive branching structures similar to lungs.

lsystem.title: L-System
lsystem.subtitle: Algorithmic Tree
lsystem.desc: Basic text rewriting rules to simulate simple trees.

windy.title: Wind Plant
windy.subtitle: Advanced Simulation
windy.desc: A complex L-system where rules create the illusion of dense foliage blown by wind.
windy.ruleNote: Complex Rule: X â†’ F+[[X]-X]-F[-FX]+X. This rule generates folded self-similarity.

dragon.title: Dragon Curve
dragon.subtitle: Heighway Fractal
dragon.desc: Famous self-similar fractal that fills space through 90-degree folds.
dragon.note: The dragon curve is a space-filling fractal using recursive folding rules.

koch.title: Snowflake
koch.subtitle: Koch Fractal
koch.desc: One of the first fractal curves described. Built iteratively by adding equilateral triangles.
koch.note: The snowflake is formed starting with a triangle and recursively adding smaller triangles to each side.

julia.title: Julia Set
julia.subtitle: Complex Dynamics
julia.desc: Fractal generated by iterating complex numbers. Each point represents chaotic or stable behavior.

lifecycle.title: Life Cycle
lifecycle.subtitle: Parametric Simulation
lifecycle.desc: Abstract model of the life cycle using polar equations for petals and phyllotaxis for the center, affected by simulated entropy.
lifecycle.note: Mathematical simulation using logistic curves for growth and decay functions for wilting.

sierpinski.title: Sierpinski Tetrahedron
sierpinski.subtitle: 3D Rodrigues Rotation
sierpinski.desc: 3D fractal demonstrating rotation around arbitrary axes.

superformula.title: Superformula
superformula.subtitle: Gielis Shapes
superformula.desc: Polar equation describing complex biological shapes.

chladni.title: Chladni Figures
chladni.subtitle: Cymatics
chladni.desc: Modal patterns on a vibrating plate.

barnsley.title: Barnsley Fern
barnsley.subtitle: Mathematical Nature
barnsley.desc: IFS fractal that replicates a fern.

phyllo.title: Phyllotaxis
phyllo.subtitle: Golden Angle
phyllo.desc: Spiral arrangement based on the golden angle.

mandelbrot.title: Mandelbrot Set
mandelbrot.subtitle: The Ultimate Fractal
mandelbrot.desc: The world's most famous fractal. Contains infinite complexity at its boundary.

sierpinskiTri.title: Sierpinski Triangle
sierpinskiTri.subtitle: Classic Fractal
sierpinskiTri.desc: One of the most recognizable fractals. Built by recursively removing triangles.

menger.title: Menger Sponge
menger.subtitle: 3D Fractal Cube
menger.desc: Three-dimensional fractal created by recursively removing cubes from the center of each face.

apollonian.title: Apollonian Gasket
apollonian.subtitle: Tangent Circles
apollonian.desc: Fractal built by filling the space between tangent circles with more circles.

dla.title: Diffusion Limited Aggregation
dla.subtitle: Coral Growth
dla.desc: Simulates coral, lichen, and crystal growth through random particles that stick to a central structure.

reactionDiffusion.title: Reaction-Diffusion
reactionDiffusion.subtitle: Turing Patterns
reactionDiffusion.desc: System of equations that generates organic patterns similar to animal skins, leopard spots, or zebra stripes.

doublePendulum.title: Double Pendulum
doublePendulum.subtitle: Chaotic Dynamics
doublePendulum.desc: Classic physical system demonstrating deterministic chaos. Small differences in initial conditions produce completely different outcomes.

waveInterference.title: Wave Interference
waveInterference.subtitle: Wave Physics
waveInterference.desc: Visualization of interference patterns when multiple wave sources overlap, creating regions of constructive and destructive interference.
